title: Understanding $$f{\left(x\right)}+h$$
text: For some value $$h$$, $$f{\left(x\right)}+h$$ means that f(x) is translated up by $$h$$ units. Similarly, $$f(x)-h$$ means that f(x) is translated down by $$h$$ units.
speech: For some value  h ,  f of x, plus, h  means that f(x) is translated up by  h  units. Similarly,  f of x minus h  means that f(x) is translated down by  h  units.

title: Understanding $$f{\left(x\right)}+h$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$-2$$, $$f(x)-2$$ means that the graph is translated down by $$2$$.
speech: Since  h  is  negative 2 ,  f of x minus 2  means that the graph is translated down by  2 .
pacedSpeech: means that the graph is translated down by   2

speech: f of x minus, 2  means that  f of 0 is equal to, 0 ,  f of 2, is equal to, negative 2 , and  f of 4 is equal to negative 1 .
